skill.name: Error Handling Gate
skill.description: Verify errors are handled gracefully with meaningful user feedback. Issues result in WARNINGS.
skill.summary: Verify errors are handled gracefully with meaningful user feedback. Issues result in WARNINGS.
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation file containing checklists and guidelines for code review. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond its own markdown file. Zero security risk.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss error handling issues that cause silent failures and poor user experience. This gate provides a structured checklist to ensure all code handles failures gracefully with helpful user feedback.
actual_capabilities: Check for empty catch blocks that silently swallow errors
Verify user-friendly error messages without technical jargon
Ensure loading states are properly cleaned up on failure
Validate error logging includes sufficient context for debugging
Confirm retry options and fallback behaviors are implemented
Review error differentiation for different failure types
limitations: This is a documentation gate for human reviewers, not automated scanning
Does not execute or test any code directly
No access to user files or project repositories
Requires manual application by developers during code review

use_cases.title: Systematic Error Review
use_cases.description: Use structured questions and checklists to review error handling during pull request reviews.

use_cases.title: Quality Gate Enforcement
use_cases.description: Establish error handling standards and verify submissions meet quality thresholds.

use_cases.title: Learn Error Patterns
use_cases.description: Study common error handling mistakes and learn best practices from the examples provided.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Error Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for error handling. Check for empty catch blocks, loading state cleanup, and user-friendly messages.

prompt_templates.title: User Feedback Review
prompt_templates.prompt: What error messages will users see? Are they actionable and free of technical jargon?

prompt_templates.title: Failure Scenario Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What happens when network fails, validation fails, or third-party APIs return errors? Walk through each failure mode.

prompt_templates.title: Production Debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: If something goes wrong in production, how would we debug it? Review error logging and context provided.

output_examples.input: Review this function for error handling quality
output: - All async calls wrapped in try/catch
- Errors logged with context for debugging

best_practices: Always wrap async operations in try/catch with meaningful error context
Provide user-friendly error messages that explain what went wrong and suggest next steps
Use finally blocks to ensure loading states and resources are always cleaned up
Log errors with sufficient context for debugging without exposing sensitive data
anti_patterns: Empty catch blocks that silently swallow errors without any logging or user feedback
Exposing technical error messages like 'TypeError: Cannot read property of undefined' to users
Missing loading state cleanup leaving UI stuck in spinning state after failures
Generic error messages like 'Error' that provide no actionable guidance to users

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes. The concepts apply to any language. Examples use JavaScript/TypeScript syntax but the principles work everywhere.

faq.question: What severity levels does this gate use?
faq.answer: High severity for empty catch blocks, medium for loading state issues, low for generic messages.

faq.question: Can this integrate with automated CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: This is a documentation guide for human reviewers. Integrate by adding these checks to your code review process.

faq.question: Does this skill access or modify any files?
faq.answer: No. This is a read-only documentation skill that provides guidelines for manual code review.

faq.question: What if our team has different error handling standards?
faq.answer: Customize the checklist and severity guide to match your team's coding standards and conventions.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated linting tools?
faq.answer: This gate catches conceptual issues that tools miss, like message quality and user experience concerns.
